info.title: CdnManagementClient
info.description: Use these APIs to manage Azure CDN resources through the Azure Resource Manager. You must make sure that requests made to these resources are secure. For more information, see Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests.

get.summary: Lists the CDN Profiles within a resource group

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

get.summary: Gets a CDN profile with the specified parameters

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

put.summary: Creates a new CDN Profile with the specified parameters

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: profileProperties
parameters.description: Profile properties needed for creation

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

202.description: Accepted and  the operation will complete asynchronously

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

patch.summary: Updates an existing CDN Profile with the specified parameters

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Profile tags to update

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

delete.summary: Deletes an existing CDN Profile with the specified parameters. Deleting a profile will result in the deletion of all sub resources including endpoints, origins and CustomDomains

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

post.summary: Generates a dynamic SSO URI used to sign in to the CDN Supplemental Portal used for advanced management tasks, such as Country Filtering, Advanced HTTP Reports, and Real-time Stats and Alerts. The SSO URI changes approximately every 10 minutes.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

parameters.name: profileName

202.description: Accepted and  the operation will complete asynchronously

patch.summary: Updates an existing CDN endpoint with the specified parameters. Only tags and OriginHostHeader can be updated after creating an endpoint. To update origins, use the Update Origin operation. To update custom domains, use the Update Custom Domain operation.

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile

parameters.name: endpointProperties
parameters.description: Endpoint properties

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

parameters.name: endpointName

parameters.name: contentFilePaths

post.summary: Check the availability of a resource name. This is needed for resources where name is globally unique (ex: endpoint). With this operation checks if the name is available or not without creating the resource.

parameters.name: checkNameAvailabilityInput
parameters.description: input to check

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

get.summary: Lists all of the available CDN REST API operations

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

Profile.description: CDN profile represents the top level resource and the entry point into the CDN API. This allows users to set up a logical grouping of endpoints in addition to creating shared configuration settings and selecting pricing tiers and providers.

value.description: List of CDN Profiles within a resource group

ProfileCreateParameters.description: Profile properties required for profile creation

SsoUri.description: Sso uri required to login to third party web portal

ssoUri.description: The uri used to login to third party web portal

Endpoint.description: CDN Endpoint is the entity within a CDN Profile containing configuration information regarding caching behaviors and origins. The CDN Endpoint is exposed using the URL format <endpointname>.azureedge.net by default, but custom domains can also be created.

hostName.description: The host name of the endpoint {endpointName}.{DNSZone}

originHostHeader.description: The host header CDN provider will send along with content requests to origins. The default value would be the host name of the origin.

originPath.description: The path used for origin requests

contentTypesToCompress.description: List of content types on which compression will be applied. The value for the elements should be Internet media type.

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the compression is enabled. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, the content transferred from cdn endpoint to end user will be compressed. The requested content must be larger than 1 byte and smaller than 1 MB.

isHttpAllowed.description: Indicates whether http traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (http or https) must be allowed.

isHttpsAllowed.description: Indicates whether https traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (http or https) must be allowed.

queryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines the query string caching behavior

origins.description: The set of origins of the CDN endpoint. When multiple origins exist, the first origin will be used as primary and rest will be used as failover options.

value.description: List of CDN Endpoints within a profile

EndpointCreateParameters.description: Endpoint properties required for new endpoint creation

EndpointUpdateParameters.description: Endpoint properties required for new endpoint creation

originHostHeader.description: The host header CDN provider will send along with content requests to origins. The default value would be the host name of the origin.

originPath.description: The path used for origin requests

contentTypesToCompress.description: List of content types on which compression will be applied. The value for the elements should be Internet media type.

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether the compression is enabled. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, the content transferred from cdn endpoint to end user will be compressed. The requested content must be larger than 1 byte and smaller than 1 MB.

isHttpAllowed.description: Indicates whether http traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (http or https) must be allowed.

isHttpsAllowed.description: Indicates whether https traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (http or https) must be allowed.

origins.description: The set of origins of the CDN endpoint. When multiple origins exist, the first origin will be used as primary and rest will be used as failover options.

DeepCreatedOrigin.description: Deep created origins within a CDN endpoint

Origin.description: CDN Origin is the source of the content being delivered via CDN. When the edge nodes represented by an Endpoint do not have the requested content cached, they attempt to fetch it from one or more of the configured Origins.

hostName.description: The host name of the origin

httpPort.description: The value of the http port, must be between 1 and 65535

httpsPort.description: The value of the https port, must be between 1 and 65535

OriginParameters.description: Origin properties required for origin creation or update

hostName.description: The host name of the origin

httpPort.description: The value of the http port, must be between 1 and 65535

httpsPort.description: The value of the https port, must be between 1 and 65535

value.description: List of CDN origins within an endpoint

CustomDomain.description: CDN CustomDomain represents a mapping between a user specified domain name and an Endpoint. It is a common practice to use custom domain names to represent the URLs for branding purposes.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain

resourceState.description: Resource status of the custom domain

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of the custom domain

CustomDomainParameters.description: CustomDomain properties required for custom domain creation or update

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain

value.description: List of CDN CustomDomains within an endpoint.

ValidateCustomDomainInput.description: Input of the custom domain to be validated

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain

CustomDomainValidated.description: Indicates whether the custom domain is validated or not

Reason.description: The reason why the custom domain is not valid

Message.description: The message on why the custom domain is not valid

CheckNameAvailabilityInput.description: Input of check name availability API

type.description: The type of the resource whose name is to be validated

CheckNameAvailabilityOutput.description: Output of check name availability API

NameAvailable.description: Indicates whether the name is available

Reason.description: The reason why the name is not available

Message.description: The detailed error message on why the name is not available

ResourceType.description: Type of CDN resource used in CheckNameAvailability

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: profile, endpoint,.. etc

operation.description: Operation type: read, write, delete,.. etc

value.description: List of CDN operations within CDN resource provider.

Sku.description: Defines a pricing tier for a profile

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request, current version is 2015-06-01
